benchmark_details.name: InfiBench
benchmark_details.overview: InfiBench is a systematic benchmark for evaluating the free-form question-answering capabilities of code large language models, comprising 234 carefully selected high-quality Stack Overflow questions that span across 15 programming languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the question-answering ability of code LLMs in real-world scenarios, facilitating the development and scientific evaluation of these models.

data.source: Filtered and selected high-quality questions from the Stack Overflow dataset.
data.annotation: Annotated by domain experts through a multi-step process including selection, paraphrasing, and correctness criteria annotation.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation scores are calculated based on a point system where correct responses earn points for each correct keyword or answer structure.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in correctly answering the questions posed in the benchmark.
methodology.validation: Questions and evaluation criteria are cross-validated to ensure correctness and objectivity.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Paraphrased questions to remove personal and sensitive information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Inferred consent through publicly accessible data and benchmark construction practices.
